sections.content:
This module offers a collection of widgets designed for use when editing the  `Home`  page.


##  <mkapi-api-link nav="@nav[w3lab]/Home/Widgets.LaunchPadView" semantic="class">LaunchPadView</mkapi-api-link> 

A container for applications' link, *e.g.*:

<launchPad size='50px'>
<app name="@mkdocs-ts/doc"></app>
<app name="@rx-vdom/doc"></app>
<app name="@webpm-client/doc"></app>
</launchPad>

##  <mkapi-api-link nav="@nav[w3lab]/Home/Widgets.ProjectsDonutChart" semantic="class">ProjectsDonutChart</mkapi-api-link> 

A donut chart that displays a histogram of  <mkapi-ext-link href="@nav[w3nest-api]/app/projects.models_project.Project">w3nest.Project</mkapi-ext-link> , *e.g.*:

<projectsDonutChart margin="70" width="75%">
    <section label="Typescript" style="fill:darkblue">
       return (p) => p.ci.tags.includes('typescript')
    </section>
    <section label="Python" class="pie-chart-py" style="fill:rebeccapurple">
       return (p) => p.ci.tags.includes('python')
    </section>
    <section  label="JavaScript" style="fill:yellow">
       return (p) => p.ci.tags.includes('javascript')
    </section>
</projectsDonutChart>

##  <mkapi-api-link nav="@nav[w3lab]/Home/Widgets.ComponentsDonutChart" semantic="class">ComponentsDonutChart</mkapi-api-link> 

A donut chart that visualizes a histogram of  <mkapi-ext-link href="@nav[w3nest-api]/app/components.models.CdnPackageLight">w3nest.CdnPackageLight</mkapi-ext-link> , *e.g.*:

<componentsDonutChart margin="70" width="75%">
    <section label="JS/WASM" style="fill:darkblue">
       return (c) => c.versions.slice(-1)[0].kind === 'esm'
    </section>
    <section label="Pyodide" style="fill:rebeccapurple">
       return (c) => c.versions.slice(-1)[0].kind === 'pyodide'
    </section>
    <section  label="Backend" style="fill:yellow">
       return (c) => c.versions.slice(-1)[0].kind === 'backend'
    </section>
    <section  label="WebApp" style="fill:darkgreen">
       return (c) => c.versions.slice(-1)[0].kind === 'webapp'
    </section>
</componentsDonutChart>

## Recent Projects

This widget displays a list of the most recently edited projects, *e.g.*:

<projectsHistoric count="5"></projectsHistoric>

Represents a link for a specific application within a  <mkapi-api-link nav="@nav[w3lab]/Home/Widgets.LaunchPadView" semantic="class">LaunchPadView</mkapi-api-link> .

Each  `AppIcon`  dynamically loads metadata (like the application name, icon) to render it.

Refer to  <mkapi-api-link nav="@nav[w3lab]/Home/Widgets.AppIcon.fromHTMLElement" semantic="method">AppIcon.fromHTMLElement</mkapi-api-link>  for constructing the view from an HTML element in MarkDown.
Children of the element.
CSS classes applied to the container, maybe modified when constructing the instance.

code.declaration: public readonly class: string = `${colabClassPrefix}-AppIcon btn btn-light btn-sm colab-AppIcon m-3`

sections.content: Inlined style specification, maybe modified when constructing the instance.
The tag of the element, equivalent to the  `tagName`  property of  `HTMLElement` .

Creates an  `AppIcon`  instance from an HTML element, typically sourced from Markdown.

This function parses the attributes of the given HTML element and converts it into an  `AppIcon`  component.

The following attributes are expected:
- **name**: The name of the application (its package name).
- **version**: The version of the application, defaults to  `'latest'`  if not specified.
- **class**: Optional CSS classes to associate with the  `AppIcon`  HTML element.
- **style**: Optional inline styles to apply to the  `AppIcon`  HTML element.
- **label**: Optional, if provided, this value will be displayed instead of the application's official  `displayName` .
- **size**: Specifies the size of the application's icon (displayed with a 1:1 aspect ratio), defaults to  `50px`  if not provided.

sections.title: Arguments
sections.content:
*  **elem**: The HTML element to parse and convert into an  `AppIcon` .
*  **size**: The default size to apply if the  `size`  attribute is not specified on the element.

sections.title: Returns
sections.content: A new instance of  `AppIcon` .

code.declaration: static fromHTMLElement(elem: Element, { size }: { size: string }): AppIcon

sections.content:
A widget that displays a donut chart representing components.

The chart's sections are determined by a selector function that takes a  <mkapi-ext-link href="@nav[w3nest-api]/app/components.models.CdnPackageLight">w3nest.CdnPackageLight</mkapi-ext-link>  as argument.

This component is designed to be embedded in a  `Markdown`  page,
refer to  <mkapi-api-link nav="@nav[w3lab]/Home/Widgets.ComponentsDonutChart.fromHTMLElement" semantic="method">ComponentsDonutChart.fromHTMLElement</mkapi-api-link> .
Children of the element.
The class associated with the element, equivalent to the  `className`  property of  `HTMLElement` .
The tag of the element, equivalent to the  `tagName`  property of  `HTMLElement` .

Constructs a  `ComponentsDonutChart`  from an HTML element, typically sourced from
 `Markdown` .

The HTML element must include specific attributes:

- **margin**: Margin of the plot in pixels, defaults to  `75` .
- **width**: Width of the plot in CSS units, defaults to  `100%` .

The sections of the chart are defined by  `section`  child elements. See  <mkapi-api-link nav="@nav[w3lab]/Home/Widgets.DonutChart.sections" semantic="method">DonutChart.sections</mkapi-api-link> 
for more details.

**Example**

<code-snippet language="html">
<componentsDonutChart margin="70" width="75%">
    <section label="JS/WASM" style="fill:darkblue">
       return (c) => c.versions.slice(-1)[0].kind === 'esm'
    </section>
    <section label="Pyodide" style="fill:rebeccapurple">
       return (c) => c.versions.slice(-1)[0].kind === 'pyodide'
    </section>
    <section  label="Backend" style="fill:yellow">
       return (c) => c.versions.slice(-1)[0].kind === 'backend'
    </section>
    <section  label="WebApp" style="fill:darkgreen">
       return (c) => c.versions.slice(-1)[0].kind === 'webapp'
    </section>
</componentsDonutChart>
</code-snippet>

<note level="hint">
Attributes of the  `c`  variable, as defined in the example, are available in
 <mkapi-ext-link href="@nav[w3nest-api]/app/components.models.CdnPackageLight">w3nest.CdnPackageLight</mkapi-ext-link> .
</note>

sections.title: Arguments
sections.content:
*  **elem**: The HTML element containing the chart configuration.
*  **router**: The application router.

sections.title: Returns
sections.content: An instance of  `ComponentsDonutChart` .

code.declaration:
static fromHTMLElement(
    elem: HTMLElement,
    router: Router,
): ComponentsDonutChart

code.implementation:
export class ComponentsDonutChart extends DonutChart<Local.Components.CdnPackageLight> {
    constructor(params: {
        appState: AppState
        innerStyle: CSSAttribute
        margin: number
        sections: DonutChartSection<Local.Components.CdnPackage>[]
    }) {
        super({
            ...params,
            entities$: params.appState.cdnState.status$.pipe(
                map((resp) => resp.packages),
            ),
        })
    }

    /**
     * Constructs a `ComponentsDonutChart` from an HTML element, typically sourced from
     * `Markdown`.
     *
     * The HTML element must include specific attributes:
     *
     * - **margin**: Margin of the plot in pixels, defaults to `75`.
     * - **width**: Width of the plot in CSS units, defaults to `100%`.
     *
     * The sections of the chart are defined by `section` child elements. See {@link DonutChart.sections}
     * for more details.
     *
     * **Example**
     *
     * <code-snippet language="html">
     * <componentsDonutChart margin="70" width="75%">
     *     <section label="JS/WASM" style="fill:darkblue">
     *        return (c) => c.versions.slice(-1)[0].kind === 'esm'
     *     </section>
     *     <section label="Pyodide" style="fill:rebeccapurple">
     *        return (c) => c.versions.slice(-1)[0].kind === 'pyodide'
     *     </section>
     *     <section  label="Backend" style="fill:yellow">
     *        return (c) => c.versions.slice(-1)[0].kind === 'backend'
     *     </section>
     *     <section  label="WebApp" style="fill:darkgreen">
     *        return (c) => c.versions.slice(-1)[0].kind === 'webapp'
     *     </section>
     * </componentsDonutChart>
     * </code-snippet>
     *
     * <note level="hint">
     * Attributes of the `c` variable, as defined in the example, are available in
     * {@link w3nest.CdnPackageLight}.
     * </note>
     *
     * @param elem The HTML element containing the chart configuration.
     * @param router The application router.
     * @returns An instance of `ComponentsDonutChart`.
     */
    static fromHTMLElement(
        elem: HTMLElement,
        router: Router,
    ): ComponentsDonutChart {
        return new ComponentsDonutChart({
            appState: router.userStore as AppState,
            margin: parseFloat(elem.getAttribute('margin')) || 75,
            innerStyle: { width: elem.getAttribute('width') || '100%' },
            sections: DonutChart.sections(elem),
        })
    }
}

sections.content: Base class for creating donut-style charts.

sections.title: Generics
sections.content: *  **T**: The type of entities being analyzed and represented in the chart.
Children of the element.
The class associated with the element, equivalent to the  `className`  property of  `HTMLElement` .
The tag of the element, equivalent to the  `tagName`  property of  `HTMLElement` .

Constructs a list of chart sections from the children of a given HTML element.

The sections are defined by  `section`  child elements within the container, each with the following attributes:

- **style**: Applied to the associated SVG element for custom styling.
- **class**: Forwarded to the associated SVG element for custom CSS classes.
- **label**: Label used to represent the section in the chart.
- **textContent**: The content of the HTML element should define a  `selector`  function (in string form).
  This function takes an entity as an argument and returns a boolean indicating whether the entity belongs to
  the section.

**Example**

<code-snippet language='html'>
<section label="Category 1" class="donut-category-1" style="fill: blue;">
    return (entity) => entity.type === 'category1';
</section>
</code-snippet>

sections.title: Arguments
sections.content: *  **elem**: The parent HTML element containing  `section`  children.

sections.title: Returns
sections.content: An array of  `DonutChartSection`  objects derived from the child  `section`  elements.

Represents a view that displays a collection of application links, arranged in a flexible grid layout.

The  `LaunchPadView`  is a container that wraps multiple  <mkapi-api-link nav="@nav[w3lab]/Home/Widgets.AppIcon" semantic="class">AppIcon</mkapi-api-link>  components, each representing an
individual application.


This component is designed to be embedded in a  `Markdown`  page,
refer to  <mkapi-api-link nav="@nav[w3lab]/Home/Widgets.LaunchPadView.fromHTMLElement" semantic="method">LaunchPadView.fromHTMLElement</mkapi-api-link> .
Children of the element.
CSS classes applied to the container.
The tag of the element, equivalent to the  `tagName`  property of  `HTMLElement` .

Creates a  `LaunchPadView`  instance from an HTML element, typically sourced from  `Markdown` .

This function parses the child elements of the given HTML element and transforms each child  `APP`  tag
into an  <mkapi-api-link nav="@nav[w3lab]/Home/Widgets.AppIcon" semantic="class">AppIcon</mkapi-api-link>  component.

**Example**

<code-snippet language='html'>
<launchPad size='50px'>
<app name="@mkdocs-ts/doc"></app>
<app name="@rx-vdom/doc"></app>
<app name="@webpm-client/doc"></app>
</launchPad>
</code-snippet>

sections.title: Arguments
sections.content: *  **elem**: The HTML element to parse and convert.

sections.title: Returns
sections.content: A new instance of  `LaunchPadView` .

Represents the view of an individual project in the projects historic.

This view displays the project's name, links to navigate to the project, and relevant cross-links for enhanced
interactivity.
Children of the element.
CSS classes applied to the container.

code.declaration: public readonly class = `${colabClassPrefix}-ProjectHistoricItemView d-flex align-items-center w-100 border rounded p-1 my-1`

sections.content: The tag of the element, equivalent to the  `tagName`  property of  `HTMLElement` .

A widget that displays a donut chart representing components.

The chart's sections are determined by a selector function that takes a  <mkapi-ext-link href="@nav[w3nest-api]/app/projects.models_project.Project">w3nest.Project</mkapi-ext-link>  as argument.

This component is designed to be embedded in a  `Markdown`  page,
refer to  <mkapi-api-link nav="@nav[w3lab]/Home/Widgets.ProjectsDonutChart.fromHTMLElement" semantic="method">ProjectsDonutChart.fromHTMLElement</mkapi-api-link> .
Children of the element.
The class associated with the element, equivalent to the  `className`  property of  `HTMLElement` .
The tag of the element, equivalent to the  `tagName`  property of  `HTMLElement` .

Constructs a  `ProjectsDonutChart`  from an  `projectsDonutChart`  HTML element, typically sourced from  `Markdown` .
The HTML element must include specific attributes:

- **margin**: Margin of the plot in pixels, defaults to  `75` .
- **width**: Width of the plot in CSS units, defaults to  `100%` .

The sections of the chart are defined by  `section`  child elements. See  <mkapi-api-link nav="@nav[w3lab]/Home/Widgets.DonutChart.sections" semantic="method">DonutChart.sections</mkapi-api-link> 
for more details.

**Example**
<code-snippet language="html">
<projectsDonutChart margin="70" width="75%">
    <section label="Typescript" style="fill:darkblue">
       return (p) => p.ci.tags.includes('typescript')
    </section>
    <section label="Python" class="pie-chart-py" style="fill:rebeccapurple">
       return (p) => p.ci.tags.includes('python')
    </section>
    <section  label="JavaScript" style="fill:yellow">
       return (p) => p.ci.tags.includes('javascript')
    </section>
</projectsDonutChart>
</code-snippet>

<note level="hint">
Attributes of the  `p`  variable, as defined in the example, are available in  <mkapi-ext-link href="@nav[w3nest-api]/app/projects.models_project.Project">w3nest.Project</mkapi-ext-link> .
</note>

sections.title: Arguments
sections.content:
*  **elem**: The HTML element containing the chart configuration.
*  **router**: The application router.

sections.title: Returns
sections.content: An instance of  `ProjectsDonutChart` .

code.declaration:
static fromHTMLElement(
    elem: HTMLElement,
    router: Router,
): ProjectsDonutChart

code.implementation:
export class ProjectsDonutChart extends DonutChart<Local.Projects.Project> {
    constructor(params: {
        appState: AppState
        innerStyle: CSSAttribute
        margin: number
        sections: DonutChartSection<Local.Projects.Project>[]
    }) {
        super({
            ...params,
            entities$: params.appState.projectsState.projects$,
        })
    }

    /**
     * Constructs a `ProjectsDonutChart` from an `projectsDonutChart` HTML element, typically sourced from `Markdown`.
     * The HTML element must include specific attributes:
     *
     * - **margin**: Margin of the plot in pixels, defaults to `75`.
     * - **width**: Width of the plot in CSS units, defaults to `100%`.
     *
     * The sections of the chart are defined by `section` child elements. See {@link DonutChart.sections}
     * for more details.
     *
     * **Example**
     * <code-snippet language="html">
     * <projectsDonutChart margin="70" width="75%">
     *     <section label="Typescript" style="fill:darkblue">
     *        return (p) => p.ci.tags.includes('typescript')
     *     </section>
     *     <section label="Python" class="pie-chart-py" style="fill:rebeccapurple">
     *        return (p) => p.ci.tags.includes('python')
     *     </section>
     *     <section  label="JavaScript" style="fill:yellow">
     *        return (p) => p.ci.tags.includes('javascript')
     *     </section>
     * </projectsDonutChart>
     * </code-snippet>
     *
     * <note level="hint">
     * Attributes of the `p` variable, as defined in the example, are available in {@link w3nest.Project}.
     * </note>
     *
     * @param elem The HTML element containing the chart configuration.
     * @param router The application router.
     * @returns An instance of `ProjectsDonutChart`.
     */
    static fromHTMLElement(
        elem: HTMLElement,
        router: Router,
    ): ProjectsDonutChart {
        return new ProjectsDonutChart({
            appState: router.userStore as AppState,
            margin: parseFloat(elem.getAttribute('margin')) || 75,
            innerStyle: { width: elem.getAttribute('width') || '100%' },
            sections: DonutChart.sections(elem),
        })
    }
}

sections.content:
Represents a view that displays the most recently edited projects.

Each item in the historic is displayed using  <mkapi-api-link nav="@nav[w3lab]/Home/Widgets.ProjectHistoricItemView" semantic="class">ProjectHistoricItemView</mkapi-api-link> .

This component is designed to be embedded in a  `Markdown`  page,
refer to  <mkapi-api-link nav="@nav[w3lab]/Home/Widgets.ProjectsHistoricView.fromHTMLElement" semantic="method">ProjectsHistoricView.fromHTMLElement</mkapi-api-link> .
Children of the element.
CSS classes applied to the container.
The tag of the element, equivalent to the  `tagName`  property of  `HTMLElement` .

Creates a  `ProjectsHistoricView`  instance from an HTML element, typically sourced from  `Markdown` .

The HTML element can feature specific attributes:

- **count**: (Optional) Maximum number of items to display. Defaults to 10.

**Example**

<code-snippet language='html'>
<projectsHistoric count="5"></projectsHistoric>
</code-snippet>

sections.title: Arguments
sections.content:
*  **elem**: The HTML element to parse and convert.
*  **router**: The application's router.

sections.title: Returns
sections.content: A new instance of  `ProjectsHistoricView` .

code.declaration:
static fromHTMLElement(
    elem: HTMLElement,
    router: Router,
): ProjectsHistoricView

sections.content: Data model representing a section within a donut chart.

sections.title: Generics
sections.content: *  **T**: The type of the entity used in the  `selector`  function to determine section membership.
Optional CSS classes applied to the associated SVG element for custom styling.
Fill color.
The label used to represent the section in the chart.

A selector function that determines whether a given entity
belongs to this section.
An optional inline style applied to the associated SVG element for custom styling.

code.implementation:
export interface DonutChartSection<T> {
    /**
     * A selector function that determines whether a given entity
     * belongs to this section.
     *
     * @param entity The entity to evaluate.
     * @returns `true` if the entity should be included in the section,
     *     `false` otherwise.
     */
    selector: (entity: T) => boolean
    /**
     * The label used to represent the section in the chart.
     */
    label: string
    /**
     * Optional CSS classes applied to the associated SVG element for custom styling.
     */
    class?: string
    /**
     * An optional inline style applied to the associated SVG element for custom styling.
     */
    style?: string

    /**
     * Fill color.
     */
    fill?: string
}

sections.content:
Creates a donut chart using D3.js within a Virtual DOM structure.

This function generates a donut chart, visualizing sections based on the provided entities and selectors.
The chart is rendered as an SVG element.

sections.title: Arguments
sections.content:
*  **params**: An object containing parameters to configure the donut chart.
*  **d3**: The D3.js library instance used to generate the chart.
*  **entities**: An array of entities to be analyzed and displayed in the chart sections.
*  **margin**: The margin size around the chart (in pixels).
*  **sections**: An array of  <mkapi-api-link nav="@nav[w3lab]/Home/Widgets.DonutChartSection" semantic="interface">DonutChartSection</mkapi-api-link>  objects defining the chart's sections,
       including labels and selectors.

sections.title: Generics
sections.content: *  **T**: The type of the entities being analyzed and represented in the chart.

sections.title: Returns
sections.content: A  `Virtual DOM`  that represents the  `div`  container.
